newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Ecuador heating oil imports rise in Feb - trader.
newsitem.headline: Ecuador heating oil imports rise in Feb - trader.

text.p: Ecuador's imports of heating oil rose in February due to low hydroelectric electricity production, an Ecuadorean oil trader said on Thursday.
He said Ecuador would import 600,000 barrels of number 2 heating oil in February, falling to 200,000 barrels in March.
"Due to the long summer, levels of water are low in the hydroelectric plants so we have had to use our thermoelectric stations to supply electricity," the source said.

He said Ecuador had bought some cargoes from Venezuela's state oil company, Petroleos de Venezuela (PDVSA) in February, but had a variety of sources of products, including Mexico, the Caribbean and the United States.
There were no operational problems at the Libertad and Esmeralda refineries, he added. Libertad has a capacity of 50,000 barrels per day (bpd) while Esmeralda's capacity is rated at 90,000 bpd.
